intro: Radlkoferella guadelupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupe radlkoferella, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Guadalupe in the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in coastal areas with sandy soils and is adapted to the island's unique climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
